Bridgewater fire claims a life

A woman was pronounced dead after being found early today in a Winter Street home engulfed in flames and smoke, according to fire officials. (Globe, 8:44 a.m.)

Rain brings temporary drought relief

With rivers low and more than 200 recent brushfires, officials are hopeful the rain will bring waterways back to equilibrium and recharge aquifers. (Globe)

Seguin seized moment like an old pro

(Nick Wass/Associated Press)
The Bruins drafted Tyler Seguin in 2010 to be a game-breaker. On Sunday, with Game 6 on the line, the 20-year-old was a season-saver. (Boston Globe)

3 Mass. ERs cited for denial of care

The hospitals were cited in the past six months for wrongly sending away patients from their emergency rooms, in one case resulting in death. (Globe) Discuss
  • 4/18 Mass. hospitals promise openness, apologies

Obesity rates down for infants, toddlers

After a three-decade tripling in childhood obesity rates, the trend has leveled off and, for the first time, appears to be on a substantial decline. (Boston Globe)
  • Get Moving | More health news | Parenting resources

Granite State shaken by violence

Ten days of bloodshed in New Hampshire during April have left residents on edge in a state that prides itself on its low homicide rate. (Boston Globe)

Special education policies in Mass. reviewed

Low-income school districts are most likely to place students in special-education programs for sometimes questionable disabilities, according to a study.

Bicycle deliveries are on the rise

Bike couriers are reporting double-digit revenue increases as cargo options expand, and many other businesses are biking their goods around Boston, too.
Opinion | Adrian Walker

No room at Senator Brown’s office

A group of Boston teenagers pushing for federal funding for summer jobs found their protests thwarted last week at the doorstep of Senator Scott Brown.

Brain surgery that’s not invasive

An experimental procedure pioneered in Boston, called MRI-guided focused ultrasound, uses 1,000 otherwise-harmless ultrasound beams to zap tumors.

Berklee College is a YouTube star

On Monday, Google named Berklee as one of nine ‘‘YouTube ambassadors,’’ organizations that have been effective at using the site to reach new customers.

Harvard Yard transformed by chairs

What was once a place people simply passed through has become a gathering spot for both students and the community, thanks to a collection of colorful chairs.
Health

Kids in the delivery room?

A growing number of hospitals say they are fielding requests from families to have children present during delivery and relaxing policies to accommodate them.
